New Records: The Dodgers set a record with 31 walks in four NLCS games, surpassing previous teams like the 1995 Yankees and 1974 Dodgers
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani's leadoff laser beam and Mookie Betts' four hits were pivotal moments in the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers focused on not chasing pitches, with Freddie Freeman emphasizing the importance of this strategy against Mets starter Jose Quintana
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the Dodgers' depth and patience at the plate as key factors in their victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' ability to force Mets pitchers into the strike zone and their deep lineup contributed to their success
